The firepower reaching into the air is quite heavy! The skies are
fairly li=
t with smoke, fire and bright lights as the Maximals and
Autobots attempt t=
o defend themselves and their position. EMP rounds,
while missing their int=
ended targets still disrupt the sweeps
targeting locks for a moment a send =
their radar systems into temporary
shut down. This allows Talon=92s weapons=
 fire to find a home, brining
down yet another sweep, leaving two of them i=
n the air overhead.

Meanwhile Tuscon is able to get an assessment of the s=
ituation as
there are currently no combatants on the ground. The sweeps are=
 down
to two now, well under half the number they started out with. However=

he can see in the distance there are more sweeps rising from an open
door =
at the tower, and there are others as well. He still can get a
bead on the =
sweeps, but the others rising up he had met before =96 the
soldiers Cyclonu=
s had brought the tower when Tuscon was trying to
fight his way out. Howeve=
r as the tower is still many kilometers away
it will take a little bit of t=
ime for them to reach his position.

**************************************=
*************************************

Meanwhile at the tower itself Rat Tr=
ap and Windlord are unable to find
a true 'hole' in the tower itself. There=
 does not appear to be any
open vents or handy cracks that lead thier way i=
n. All the vents are
currently closed, firmly and securely, and they would =
need to be,
after all this is a tower designed to descend into liquid rock.=

However they are able to find a spot where the walls on the upper
tower ju=
t out slightly, a small crevass. However it is very small, and
it in no way=
 leads into the tower itself, but it is merely a small
cubby hole type stru=
cture.

The only way discernable into the tower itself, short of blowing a
=
hole in the wall, and judgingh by the material of the wall this would
take =
a lot of firepower, the only way in is the large door that the
soldiers had=
 just left from - the door that is even now continuing to
close.

*********=
******************************************************************

At the =
Ark there is no answer to Quickstride's challenge. The air that
had rippled=
 before stopped, or atleast it was no longer visible to
him.

"What do you =
see?" Rodimus' voice comes over the speaker. "My sensors
aren't picking up =
anyth . . ." Rodimus' voice goes silent as the world
around Quickstride goe=
s completely dark. He cannot see anything, not
even his hand in front of hi=
s face, nor can he hear anything, not even
the sound of his own voice. It i=
s like his audio and visual sensors
have gone offline.
